intro: Sida erubescens, commonly known as redroot sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, dry fruits called capsules. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Sida erubescens is known for its ability to tolerate a wide range of environmental conditions.
